Entry.JapaneseText: [VARIABLE]
Entry.EnglishText: [VARIABLE]

Entry.JapaneseText: 女の人
Entry.EnglishText: Woman

Entry.JapaneseText: <Veigue>
Entry.EnglishText: <Veigue>

Entry.JapaneseText: select
Entry.EnglishText: Select

Entry.JapaneseText: ベルサス・民家
Entry.EnglishText: Belsas - Residence

Entry.JapaneseText: ベルサス・民家
Entry.EnglishText: Belsas - Residence

Entry.JapaneseText: 民家
Entry.EnglishText: Residence

Entry.JapaneseText: この街の権力者はスカラベさんよ。 あの人がガジュマ嫌いだから、 それに逆らえない人もいるみたいよ……
Entry.EnglishText: Scarabe is a powerful person in this town. He hates Gajuma, and it seems no one in town wants to call him out on it...

Entry.JapaneseText: 前からガジュマ嫌いの人は 多かったけど、最近、その雰囲気が 何倍にも強くなってるみたいなの……
Entry.EnglishText: There have always been a lot of people in this town who hate Gajuma, but it seems lately that their hatred is growing exponentially...

Entry.JapaneseText: 半年くらい前に、私は他の街から ここに越して来たんだけど…… 最初はびっくりしたわ……
Entry.EnglishText: I moved here from another town.

Entry.JapaneseText: 当たり前のように、 ヒューマがガジュマの事を 嫌ってるんだもの……
Entry.EnglishText: Huma here hate Gajuma as a matter of course... I was really shocked at first...

Entry.JapaneseText: あなた…… この街のガジュマにしては、 ずいぶんキレイな格好ね……
Entry.EnglishText: Compared to the other Gajuma in this town, you're rather well-dressed.

Entry.JapaneseText: 下手に街を歩いて目立つと、 ヒューマたちにいじめられるわ。 早く仲間の所へ行ったほうがいいわよ。
Entry.EnglishText: You'll open yourself up to harassment from Huma because you stand out so much. Best to go back to where your kinsmen are.

Entry.JapaneseText: あなた、その服装からいって、 スールズの子でしょ？
Entry.EnglishText: Judging by your clothes, you must be from Sulz?

Entry.JapaneseText: ああ……
Entry.EnglishText: Yeah...

Entry.JapaneseText: スールズって、 おだやかでいい村よね…… 私もこんな街、早く出て、 スールズに行こうかなぁ……
Entry.EnglishText: I've heard that Sulz is quite the peaceful village... Hopefully I can leave here soon and go there...

Entry.JapaneseText: あなたたちみたいに、 ヒューマとガジュマが一緒に いるのって、なんだかとても 新鮮に見えるわ……
Entry.EnglishText: Seeing Gajuma and Huma walking around together is quite a refreshing sight.

Entry.JapaneseText: 少し前までは、当たり前だった ような気がするんだけどな……
Entry.EnglishText: It seems that was the norm not too long ago...

Entry.JapaneseText: ……ヒューマとガジュマの 話し合いか……
Entry.EnglishText: Huma and Gajuma are to hold a discussion...

Entry.JapaneseText: スカラベさんも、 少しは反省したのかな…… 明日の会合には行かなくちゃね……
Entry.EnglishText: I wonder if Scarabe has reflected on his actions... I'll guess I'll have to go to the meeting to see for myself...

Entry.JapaneseText: アガーテ様の演説を聞いてたら 涙が出ちゃったわ……
Entry.EnglishText: Queen Agarte's speech brought a tear to my eye...

Entry.JapaneseText: 私の住んでた街でも、 よくみんなで集まって、 楽しくやってた……
Entry.EnglishText: In the town where I used to live, we would all gather together and have fun, too...

Entry.JapaneseText: ああ、ふるさとに帰りたく なっちゃったな……
Entry.EnglishText: Oh dear, now I'm feeling quite homesick.

Entry.JapaneseText: ……軍の人って、もめごとや ケンカは止めてくれるけど…… ヒューマとガジュマが仲良くなる のとは、別なのよね……
Entry.EnglishText: Those military men have been doing a good job at preventing fights from breaking out, but making Huma and Gajuma get along is a whole different beast...

Entry.JapaneseText: どうしたら、ガジュマの人たちと 仲良くできるのかしらね……
Entry.EnglishText: I wonder if we will be able to get along with Gajuma...

Entry.JapaneseText: ジルバ様の演説の噂が広まってから、 ガジュマの兵隊さんの態度が とっても恐い感じなの……
Entry.EnglishText: Because of the rumors about Lady Zilva's speech, the Gajuma soldiers' behavior has grown more concerning...

Entry.JapaneseText: 軍の人がヒューマとか ガジュマとか言い出したら よくないと思うんだけど……
Entry.EnglishText: I don't think it's a good idea for military personnel to talk about Huma this or Gajuma that...

Entry.JapaneseText: 私、この前、ジャンニさんって ガジュマの女の人と会ったの。
Entry.EnglishText: I met a Gajuma woman named Gianni the other day...

Entry.JapaneseText: 色々大変だけど、みんなが 仲良く暮らせるように、 協力するって約束したの。
Entry.EnglishText: Even though a lot has happened, I promised her that I would work together with her to create a town where everyone gets along.

Entry.JapaneseText: この音、いつまで続くのかしら？ 考え事したいのに、集中できなくって。
Entry.EnglishText: When will this noise stop? I can't even hear myself think...

Entry.JapaneseText: ジャンニさんのがんばりのおかげで 少しずつ協力してくれる人が 増えてるみたい。
Entry.EnglishText: Because of Gianni's efforts, more and more people are starting to cooperate.

Entry.JapaneseText: すぐにはうまく行かなくても、 きっといつか……ね！
Entry.EnglishText: We might not all get along right away, but surely someday we will!

Entry.JapaneseText: 私はよそ者だけど、 街のみんなと仲良くやってるわ。
Entry.EnglishText: I'm not from around here, but I get along with everyone in town.

Entry.JapaneseText: ガジュマが嫌いなふりも してるし……
Entry.EnglishText: I do have to pretend to hate Gajuma, though...

Entry.JapaneseText: ……私って世渡り上手？ それとも単なる 八方美人なのかしら……？
Entry.EnglishText: I can't tell if I'm just good at blending in or if I'm a people pleaser...

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0><scale:140>休憩しますか？ はい いいえ
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0><scale:140>Would you like to rest? Yes No

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0>『手ぬいのテーブルクロス』 この家の女の人が作って、道具屋に 卸しているテーブルクロス。 ベルサスの金持ちたちの間で人気。 半年先まで予約でいっぱい。
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0>- Hand-Stitched Tablecloth - Made by the woman who lives here, these tablecloths are sold at the Item shop. A favorite amongst the wealthy in Belsas. Her orders are backed up for 6 months.
